name: TOI-216
scenarioDescription:
The TOI-216 Exoplanetary System


Overview

TOI-216 is a star with 0.87 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.84 times its radius. It is located 583.30 light years away from the solar system.

TOI-216 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the TOI-216 system


TOI-216 b

TOI-216 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TOI-216 b is 30.01602 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TOI-216 b is 7.69 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, TOI-216 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


TOI-216 c

TOI-216 c was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.21 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TOI-216 c is 200.10786 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TOI-216 c is 11.29 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, TOI-216 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system TOI-216, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
